channel.title: 2016 Olympics
channel.description:
So, anyone followed the election for the host city?
It was 8:00 in the morning here in a holiday, so I thought I might as well see it. Turns out it's gonna be Rio, which is like 300km away, so I'll definitely be there if I'm still living here :smiley: .
Madrid had a more solid project IMO, but I'm still happy they're hosting it here.

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Wasabi
item.description:
Yo Rio, I’m really happy for you, and imma let you finish, but China had one of the best Olympics of all time.

Read full topic

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Master Chef:

I LOL’d when I saw the video where the Tea Party Pricks were cheering that Chicago didn’t get the spot and claimed it as a Republican victory.

Wait, why? I mean, as I said above, I’m happy Chicago doesn’t get it, but how is it a Republican victory? Not to turn this thread into a massive political debate.

Read full topic

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Jeannotvb:

I’m going to lock myself into an isolation room a thousand meters underground to make sure I get through 2012.

Earthquakes?
The only safe place, really, is in a floating bubble loosely anchored to the ocean floor, resting a hundred leagues beneath the surface.

So, Dillxn? You don’t remember the Atlanta olympics? They were huge, the centennial of recent olympic celebrations. You’ll probably recognize its theme from being repeated in recent olympiads:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10SWNWzGq1U

Read full topic

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Dillxn:

Sorry, Raw_Bean, didn’t mean to derail the thread D: I need to be more considerate.
Anyway, I’m disappointed it didn’t come to Chicago. I’m too young to remember any Olympic game in America.

I’m glad. If it had been here all we would have heard about for the entire construction would be how “eco-friendly” it will be. I have a burning hatred for putting eco-friendlyness over productivity and cost effectiveness, so I would spend the next 6 years yelling at Obama to shut up about it. Not that I don’t do that already, of course.

Read full topic

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
GordonReturns:

One of my professors talked about it(and surprisingly, he talked about the financial status of the US and about how Bush and Obama have been handling it, but that is unrelated to the main topic). Not many people were losing sleep over Obama not winning us a closer Olympic spot.

Are you kidding? I was on the edge of my seat for the entire thing!

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Mith:

I’m pretty sure he was referring to living through the 2012 Olympics, as in “no one’s gonna care about 2016’s olympics until the next one is done”. I could be wrong though.

I suspect you are, as no one is thinking that the 2012 olympics will end the world.

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
My apologies, raw_bean.

I’m glad that Rio got 2016. I wish it was the United States, but evidently, other venues were better according to the Olympic committee. I love watching the Olympics. Especially the female figure skaters (those that are of age, of course).

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Dillxn:

He spent more in the first few months of his presidency than Bush did his entire time in office.

Y’know, being an Obama supporter, I’d answer to this (and the rest of your foolish post), but there isn’t a “Flames and Bullshit” section on this forum so I’ll leave it there.

Read full topic

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
Dillxn:

Lol I can’t stand Obama.
I just want to go up to every supporter of his who still wear the retarded comparing-Obama-to-MLK shirts, and talk about his “change,” and ask them what good change he’s brought. He spent more in the first few months of his presidency than Bush did his entire time in office. And what has it gotten us? Zip. Good job, America! We were successfully fooled into turning the US election into a popularity contest. whispers softly Good job, America…

You really should be glad about the health system reforms and the amount of effort he’s putting in to stop your country from becoming bankrupt.
He’s also helped the international view on America GREATLY.

Read full topic

item.title: 2016 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
Dillxn:

He spent more in the first few months of his presidency than Bush did his entire time in office. And what has it gotten us? Zip.

That’s unfair, the financial crysis started before his election so that’s why he spent thousands of billions $ (with more or less success).
Bush spent more than that with his irakian war which cost one billion $ a day (since it started in 2003 and there’s 365 day in a year, I’ll leave you the calculation)…
